title: Windows 11 KB5058499 update rolls out new Share and Click to Do features
summary: ​​Microsoft has released the KB5058499 preview cumulative update for Windows 11 24H2 with forty-eight new features or changes, with many gradually rolling out, such as the new Windows Share feature and tje Click to Do Preview. [...]

title: APT41 malware abuses Google Calendar for stealthy C2 communication
summary: The Chinese APT41 hacking group uses a new malware named 'ToughProgress' that abuses Google Calendar for command-and-control (C2) operations, hiding malicious activity behind a trusted cloud service. [...]

title: New PumaBot botnet brute forces SSH credentials to breach devices
summary: A newly discovered Go-based Linux botnet malware named PumaBot is brute-forcing SSH credentials on embedded IoT devices to deploy malicious payloads. [...]

title: Interlock ransomware gang deploys new NodeSnake RAT on universities
summary: The Interlock ransomware gang is deploying a previously undocumented remote access trojan (RAT) named NodeSnake against educational institutes for persistent access to corporate networks. [...]

title: Pakistan Arrests 21 in ‘Heartsender’ Malware Service
summary: Authorities in Pakistan have arrested 21 individuals accused of operating "Heartsender," a once popular spam and malware dissemination service that operated for more than a decade. title: Iranian Hacker Pleads Guilty in $19 Million Robbinhood Ransomware Attack on Baltimore
summary:
An Iranian national has pleaded guilty in the U.S. over his involvement in an international ransomware and extortion scheme involving the Robbinhood ransomware.

title: Botnet hacks 9,000+ ASUS routers to add persistent SSH backdoor
summary: Over 9,000 ASUS routers are compromised by a novel botnet dubbed "AyySSHush" that was also observed targeting SOHO routers from Cisco, D-Link, and Linksys. [...]

title: Dark Partners cybercrime gang fuels large-scale crypto heists
summary: A sprawling network of fake AI, VPN, and crypto software download sites is being used by the "Dark Partner" threat actors to conduct a crypto theft attacks worldwide. [...]

title: Czech Republic Blames China-Linked APT31 Hackers for 2022 Cyberattack
summary:
The Czech Republic on Wednesday formally accused a threat actor associated with the People's Republic of China (PRC) of targeting its Ministry of Foreign Affairs.

title: Czechia blames China for Ministry of Foreign Affairs cyberattack
summary: The Czech Republic says the Chinese-backed APT31 hacking group was behind cyberattacks targeting the country's Ministry of Foreign Affairs and critical infrastructure organizations. [...]

title: Microsoft OneDrive File Picker Flaw Grants Apps Full Cloud Access — Even When Uploading Just One File
summary:
Cybersecurity researchers have discovered a security flaw in Microsoft's OneDrive File Picker that, if successfully exploited, could allow websites to access a user's entire cloud storage content, as opposed to just the files selected for upload via the tool.

title: Microsoft introduces new Windows backup tool for businesses
summary: Microsoft has introduced Windows Backup for Organizations, a new backup tool for enterprises that simplifies backups and makes the transition to Windows 11 easier. [...]

title: New PumaBot Botnet Targets Linux IoT Devices to Steal SSH Credentials and Mine Crypto
summary:
Embedded Linux-based Internet of Things (IoT) devices have become the target of a new botnet dubbed PumaBot.
Written in Go, the botnet is designed to conduct brute-force attacks against SSH instances to expand in size and scale and deliver additional malware to the infected hosts.

title: Microsoft wants Windows to update all software on your PC
summary: Microsoft has introduced a new update orchestration platform built on the existing Windows Update infrastructure, which aims to unify the updating system for all apps, drivers, and system components on Windows systems. [...]

title: From Infection to Access: A 24-Hour Timeline of a Modern Stealer Campaign
summary:

title: Mimo Hackers Exploit CVE-2025-32432 in Craft CMS to Deploy Cryptominer and Proxyware
summary:
A financially motivated threat actor has been observed exploiting a recently disclosed remote code execution flaw affecting the Craft Content Management System (CMS) to deploy multiple payloads, including a cryptocurrency miner, a loader dubbed Mimo Loader, and residential proxyware.
